words.definition: To advertise is to tell people about something on TV, radio, etc.
words.example: They used a rabbit to help them advertise their product.

words.definition: To assign something to someone is to tell them to do it.
words.example: I assigned the worker an important task.

words.definition: An audience is a group of people who watch something together.
words.example: There was a large audience at the game.

words.definition: Breakfast is the first meal of the day.
words.example: I eat breakfast at 8:00 every morning.

words.definition: A competition is a contest to see who is the best at something.
words.example: He won the running competition over the weekend.

words.definition: If the weather is cool, it is a little bit cold.
words.example: The weather is cool in the fall.

words.definition: If you gain something, you get more of it.
words.example: I gained some weight over the summer.

words.definition: Importance means the quality or condition of being needed or valued.
words.example: VIPs are people of great importance.

words.definition: Knowledge is information that you have about something.
words.example: A music teacher should have good knowledge of music.

words.definition: If something is major, it is big or important.
words.example: I have a major problem. My boss wants me to redo my project!

words.definition: Mean describes someone who is unkind or cruel.
words.example: My co-worker is a very mean person. He gets angry very quickly.

words.definition: If you prefer something, you want it more than something else.
words.example: I prefer to take the path that will lead me to a bright future.

words.definition: A president is the leader of a country.
words.example: The president of our country made an important announcement.

words.definition: Progress is the act of getting closer to doing or finishing something.
words.example: Our company made financial progress this year.

words.definition: Respect is a good opinion of someone because they are good.
words.example: I have great respect for firemen.

words.definition: If you are rich, you have a lot of money.
words.example: Heâ€™s rich. He can buy anything he wants.

words.definition: A skill is the knowledge and ability that allows you to do something well.
words.example: A snowboarder must have the right skills to do well.

words.definition: Somehow means in a way or by some means which is not known.
words.example: He somehow had to find a way to reach the life preserver.

words.definition: Strength is the physical power that you have.
words.example: Exercising will increase your strength and give you more power.

words.definition: To vote is to officially choose between two or more things.
words.example: I voted for Billy to be our class president.
